Key Arguments: The legislation is equated with the introduction of Communism, which the author views negatively based on personal experience.
The bill is seen as a threat to free speech, likening it to Marxist/Communist/Socialist ideologies.
The author believes that Australian elites and politicians are serving international agendas (UN and EU) rather than the interests of Australian citizens.
The author expresses a strong emotional response, viewing the legislation as a betrayal of the sacrifices made by soldiers in World Wars to protect freedom.
Main Themes: Fear of loss of free speech
Notable Quotes: This Bill basically ushers in Communism and all of its inherent deterrents, restrictions, consequences, and punishments.
This Bill deprives every Australian citizen of having free speech and that is exactly the core of Marxist/Communism/Socialism.
I give you all absolutely NO consent to proceed with this Bill and will ask my God to deal with those that introduce it.
